newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Transaero to fly to Taiwan, Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Transaero to fly to Taiwan, Hong Kong.

text.p: Private Russian airline AO Transaero will start passenger flights to Taiwan, Hong Kong and Manchester in June, a company chief executive said on Tuesday.
Alexander Pleshakov told a news conference that Transaero would fly from Moscow to Taiwan once a week and to Hong Kong and Manchester twice a week.
Scheduled flights to Tel Aviv were also planned and the airline would operate charters to Spain, Italy, Greece, Cyprus, Turkey, Portugal and Tunisia in its summer schedule, he added.
Transaero operates 14 aircraft, including five Boeing 737s, five Boeing 757s, three DC-10-30s and one Ilyushin-86.
It has already said it will lease an additional Boeing 767 for long-range flights, as well as several Boeing 737-400s for medium-range domestic and international flights.
Pleshakov said Transaero spent $25 million on fleet maintenance last year, as well as $1 million for training and $2 million to modernise its home airport Sheremetyevo-One.
Russia's Aeroflot International Airlines owns five per cent of Transaero.
